doc.content: A few days before Christmas in 1996, Robert Grajewski saw a tiny brown animal sniffing around his mailbox as he pulled out of the driveway on his way to work. When he got home that evening a puppy, with no collar or tags, was hiding behind a snow shovel leaning on the front porch of his house. She was so small Grajewski said he could "see her head sticking out one side and her tail wagging on the other." It took just an open door and a kind word to get her inside.
